page.title: 14TRADE, PADIHAM MARKET LANCS
page.content: There has been a market for around 200 years. However, because of its location on the river bank, flooding occurred and in 1884 new land was acquired. In 1956 the market closed. 27/3/84 saw the re-opening of a new market at a cost of Â£120 000. This permanent outdoor fixture, of modern materials is enhanced by landscaping and local stone. Stall keepers and local inhabitants feel that Sat may not have been a wise choice. Many shops take half-day closing, and local shoppers prefer to travel to the larger towns of Burnley Accrington and Blackburn. Therefore 4/9/85 saw the addition of a Wed market, not to replace Sat however. Whether the market will succeed in re-vitalising the town is a matter for speculation.
